d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Our family is selling Christmas trees & Wagon Rides\!
$75 includes a horse drawn wagon ride for your entire family out to our lot to select the perfect Christmas tree, any size\! Our trees are beautiful, fresh cut grown wild in Montana\. We will trim it up & deliver it to your vehicle, of course, by horse drawn wagon\.
Looking for just a wagon ride? $3 per person around our family farm\. Enjoy our livestock including our resident bison, watusi cattle, donkey, chickens & more\! Have a large group? No problem\. We take reservations\!
Open Monday thru Friday, 4 pm to 9 pm\. Saturday 9 am to 9 pm\. Closed Sundays\.
Visit our Facebook page at @BertsFamilyChristmasTrees for more details\. We would love to see you\!
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Bert's Family Christmas Trees & Wagon Rides

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Teen DIY

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
What is Luminaria? You’ll have to experience it yourself to find out, but we’ll do our best to give you an idea or two. Imagine all the light displays you’ve seen before. Now, imagine something entirely different and you’re on the right track.
This enchanting mile walk will transport you into a magical holiday world as you make your way through the captivating Ashton Gardens. The Grand Allee’s 8,000 programmable luminaries blanket the sweeping hill, where each one acts as a pixel in a moving picture of blooming poinsettias, flying reindeer, and dynamic symbols of the season. And on top of that 40-foot hill, you’ll be met with the colossal 120-foot tree—all lit up and ready to be admired.
Looking for a quiet moment of reflection? View the nativity scene before entering the new Light of the World Garden. Glowing lanterns and peaceful music accompany this space featuring 35 monument- sized bronze sculptures depicting scenes of Jesus Christ from the New Testament.
Continue your holiday stroll while indulging all your senses in special touches like s’mores at the glowing fire pits, hot chocolate and sweets from the gift boutique, interactive game areas for children and adults alike, even peppermint-scented mulch.
___
Luminaria. It’s a holiday spectacular that’s unlike anything you’ve experienced before. Only at Thanksgiving Point. Make this the first year of your new tradition and come experience the light.
*Dates and times are limited. Purchase tickets in advance as we cannot guarantee the availability of walk-up tickets.*
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Luminaria: Experience the Light
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:PriceText: Thanksgiving Point members receive a 10% discount

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
This Holiday Season, join Microsoft and FutureINDesign (FIND) to raise funds for low-income youth pursuing careers in STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics) related fields.
TECH BAR TRIVIA NIGHT -- a playful giving event supporting FutureINDeisgn -- is a chance for ten companies to represent ten local youth in a trivia contest. Each company will bring two of their best and brightest employees to team up with 1 community leader and 1 FIND student to compete against other local contributors. At the end of the evening, the winning teams will award their student with a Microsoft Surface Pro 4 to aid them in their future studies.
• Public audiences will also have the opportunity to experience firsthand the brand new Surface Studio, VR (Virtual Reality) worlds, Xbox gaming and an interactive holiday photo booth.
• Donate to FIND at the event for a chance to win an Xbox One S!
This is a public event. All participants are welcome to bring family and friends to enjoy a fun night of community and emerging technology.
RSVP on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/events/661933153983365/
Visit us online at futureindesign.org
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: TECH BAR TRIVIA NIGHT
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Venue: Microsoft Store at City Creek Center

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
UNDERPRIVILEGED YOUTH ALONG WITH TECH GIANTS FROM SLC COMMUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN BATTLE OF WITS GAME NIGHT
Tech Bar Trivia Night fundraiser to support youth pursuing careers in STEAM
SALT LAKE CITY, Utah, Nov 29, 2016 – FutureINDesign today announced a game night fundraiser set up to help raise funds for and give computers to low-income youth pursuing careers in fields related to STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts and mathematics) while honoring and celebrating tech giants in the community.
Ten companies represent ten youth in a trivia contest. Each company brings two of their best and brightest employees to team up with a community leader and youth each. This foursome, together, during a battle of wits, throws their best and brightest answers for their chance to win a Microsoft Surface Pro 4.
Event Details
Date: December 1, 2016
Time: 5-8 PM
Location: Microsoft City Creek, City Creek Center, 51 Main St #145, Salt Lake City, UT 84111
Cost: FREE
Public audiences will have the opportunity to experience firsthand the brand new Surface Studio, Virtual Reality worlds, Xbox gaming and an interactive holiday photo booth. Donate at the event to FIND for a chance to win an Xbox One S! All participants are welcome to bring family and friends to enjoy a fun night of community and emerging technology.
“We are committed to being a part of the fabric of the local communities in which we operate,” states Valeria Rodriguez, Microsoft Product Advisor in a statement. “We are excited to work with FutureINDesign, which is striving to do the same by increasing opportunities for Utah’s under-represented young adults. We hope this event will not only capture the hard work that FIND and its partners have contributed, but also showcase a program full of possibilities for at-risk youth. Communities everywhere should be apprised of the need to narrow the digital literacy gap through programs like FIND.”
“Pluralsight’s mission has always been and always will be to democratize technology education,” explains Isaac Strack, Senior Content Strategist for Pluralsight. “Trivia night is an opportunity to raise awareness, to celebrate something that is truly amazing and, of course, to have some fun!”
“Our team’s mission is to build and promote a vibrant STEAM culture in Utah that nurtures, attracts and inspires the best and brightest workforce, while strengthening Adobe’s brand of innovation,” explains Brad Daw, Computer Scientist and Software Developer for Adobe and part of the Adobe Steam Team. “We hope to accomplish several things as we participate with FutureINDesign, including encouraging positive contributions to society through technology, supporting STEAM Education and Education Policy on the Hill, and ensuring that our Utah talent pipeline has the interest and skills to ‘Change the world through digital experiences’.”
“70 percent of people believe that women don’t belong as authorities in architecture. I know I can prove them wrong,” explains one young, hope-filled participant, currently plowing through the beginnings of her schooling in architecture and design.
When asked about their legacy, here were a few FutureINDesign students’ responses:
• “I want to be an example for other people from my [diverse] community.”
• “I want to motivate other women, especially refugee women. I want them to know to never doubt themselves. We are capable of anything.”
• “Sometimes I feel like I am a target and that people don’t want me in the workforce. I want to change that for younger generations.”
“Partners and allies, come for a glimpse into the amazing paths our work together is forging for these young people,” urges Nicholina Womack, CEO and Founder of FutureINDesign. “These young people are more than eager to make change for themselves and leave a legacy for others as well. Please join us for our event and meet these young adults yourself and hear their incredible stories.”
###
**About FIND:** FutureINDesign, dedicated to STEAM career development for marginalized youth, is a Utah-based 501 (c)(3) organization founded in 2015. Its mission is to narrow the digital literacy gap in Utah through immersive training in key technology and life skills, thereby reducing constraints of intergenerational poverty and creating a pipeline of talent for our community’s growing tech workforce.
Contact Information Liz Coleman | 206.512.6570 elizabethevacoleman@gmail.com
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: FutureINDesign game night fundraiser

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
A favorite holiday attraction is returning to Utah this November for its second season. Christmas in Color will open to the public November 18, 2016 and run through December 31, 2016. The mile-long drive-through light and music display will feature one million led lights synchronized to favorite holiday tunes.
Visitors will enjoy the vibrant displays from the comfort of their own cars as they travel through glowing tunnels and passed fields of twinkling lights. Attendees tune their radios to a local channel upon entering the exhibit to watch the lights dance in coordination to the music.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Christmas in Color

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Part I: Managing Your Cash Flow The Number One reason businesses fail is that they run out money\! Come learn what most small businesses owners do not know to help avoid the ruin of your company Why you have so little cash when your income statement shows a good profit? Why you can be profitable, but still go bankrupt\. Why your primary focus needs to be on maximizing cash flow, not on profits\. Why using your bank ledger as the primary way to manage cash flow is not a good thing to do\. What are the tools you have to maximize your cash flow\. How can you use financial statements to manage your cash flow\. Over 20 years of small business finance experience Adjunct professor of finance at Webster University, Hill AFB Where to nd cash in your company\. How to use debt as a tool and not a crutch\.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Ca$h Flow is King

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
As an entrepreneur, it can be confusing and overwhelming to know where to start or what to do. Do you struggle with….
Stress and overwhelm, not knowing where to start and how to find new clients? ___
Self Sabotage in not following through on what you know? ___
Getting it all done and still having a home life? ___
Are you tired of wasting time and money trying to find clients?
As a small business owner, we don't generally have a team working with us. Many of us do the slipper commute (work from home) or work on our own. It can feel confusing, frustrating and isolating…
___
But you don't have to go it alone.
___
My first 3 years in business, I struggled needlessly. I wasted thousands of dollars in marketing and thousands of hours. I spent thousands on business education - and eventually I learned the psychology of marketing and sales.
___
But it wasn't enough just to know what to do- you also have to follow through on what you know. And that's why I created this program.
___
It combines 6 weeks of lessons on the essential topics of running a business, finding clients and making your first 100 sales. It's structured with both interactive know how of the psychology of marketing and sales and knowing exactly what to do to attract clients. Learn about the 6 Key Areas of Business: Marketing, Sales, Cash Flow, Motivation, Productivity, Building Your Team and more!
___
Plus, get your BRAIN out of: Overwhelm, Lack of Motivation, Low Confidence and Self Sabotage and set up your Brain for Focus, Drive and Consistent Action so you can Succeed!
___
Here's the Lessons included in Brain Power Your Small Business with Hypnosis:
Lesson 1: Visioneering Your Business. Designing your business to fit your life and clarifying your purpose, mission and vision. Anything you want to achieve in life always starts with Vision and your Belief your Success. Hypnosis: Visioneer Your Future ___
Lesson 2: The Power of Words + Word of Mouth Marketing. When you understand the psychology of words, you can get really clear about your message and your market. Develop your brand, your elevator pitch, your tagline and more. Define who you are talking to and how to talk about your business. Hypnosis: Attract Clients Now ___
Lesson 3: Psychology of Sales. Know what people look for before they buy. Learn the skills to make sales easy and comfortable. Plus, understand the principles of your business brand, reputation and how to get referrals. Hypnosis: Step Into Confidence ___
Lesson 4: Create Ease with Money. If you have stress habits with money, your mind could be repelling the very money you desire - creating sabotage and costing you clients. Learn the best money practices for your business. Plus, identify and clear any money blocks that are stopping so you can release self sabotage around money and create ease and flow. Hypnosis: Train Your Brain for Wealth & Prosperity ___
Lesson 5: 44 Marketing Strategies After this class, you'll always know what to do and where to go to find clients. Map out the best strategies for you and your business, develop your plan and create a steady flow of clients. Hypnosis: Overwhelm to Organized! ___
Lesson 6: Keep Clients Coming Back. Learn what it takes to keep clients coming back. It costs 50% more to keep finding new clients. Learn strategies to stay in touch and stay connected with clients, keep them coming back -and get referrals. Hypnosis: Systems & Flow in Business ___
You don't have to struggle like I did. Don't waste your time and money while struggling to survive in business.
___
The number 1 reason small businesses fail is lack of marketing and finding clients. Over the last 10 years of running my business and starting from ground zero - TWICE - I've found what works.
___
Plus, I've worked with over 1,000 business owners on Motivation, Confidence, Focus, Strategy and more. Let me share with you the Know How AND The Brain Skills to attract clients and grow your business.
___
If you're a small business owner, I know you have a vision and passion to bring your business to the world. And if you're like most of us, you truly want to help people. For many of us solopreneurs - our businesses are the vehicle to bring our life purpose, mission and vision to the world.
___
Join other entrepreneurs for feedback, focus, motivation, confidence and more.
Meet Online or In Person in Salt Lake City, UT at Life Harmony Wellness Center: 555 E. 4500 S. Suite C-250, Murray, UT 84107
___
See details and Register at: http://thebraintrainerllc.com/business/brain-power-small-business-hypnosis/
___
Holly Stokes, The Brain Trainer, has more than 20 years experience in the field of applied psychology. Through Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP), Hypnosis and Coaching, she loves empowering clients to lead healthier, happier lives by engaging the power of the mind. She has authored two books and created several CDs designed to rewire the brain for weight loss, health, happiness and success and loves to empower people with 'Brain Skills' for life. She has been quoted by Shape Magazine, Active Times and Chicago Tribune and appears on radio shows and local TV. She says, "Whatever you want to create in your life - the answers are in your brain."
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Brain Power Your Small Business with Hypnosis 6 Week Class

d2p1:jsLink.d2p1:name: Brain Power Your Small Business with Hypnosis 6 Week Class

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Cha Cha is upbeat and exciting, and will challenge your mind and body as you learn the steps, technique, and choreography to make a great routine while working with great people\!
Anyone with a little dance experience can join, no partner required\. Participants don’t need Cha Cha experience, but should have a month or two of some dance style under their belts\. If you consider yourself a beginner/intermediate dancer, this course is for you\!
Thursdays 12\.01 \- 03\.02 from 7\-7:50pm \(no classes 12\.22 & 12\.29 because let's face it, everyone is BUSY during the holidays\!\)
This Cha Cha group will meet every week for 12 weeks \- culminating in a performance at DF's Fire & Ice Ball on Saturday March 4\. You’ll get an in\-depth experience with the Cha Cha style and build great friendships with people in the group\!
Cost: $10 per class for 12 wks, paid upfront \- $120 total – No costume fees or team fees – we’ll keep it simple\.
BONUS: For a limited time, with the purchase of this 12 wk Cha Cha Challenge you can purchase 12 wk Social Dance Crash Course \(which will cover Swing, Foxtrot, Nightclub 2 Step, & Rumba\) for 50% off\! Crash Course runs parallel with Cha Cha on Thursdays at 8pm, so you get more dance experience & meet more people\! Call 801\.466\.0490 to get this deal\.
http://www\.dfdancestudio\.com/cha\-cha\-challenge 2978 S State St SLC 801\.466\.0490
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Shine Onstage with the Cha Cha Challenge!

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Dan Holland, an animator for Pixar Animation
___
Studios, will be presenting an artist talk at the Southern Utah Museum of Art on December 1,
___
2016, at 7:00 pm. Holland’s presentation is part of the Art Insights series hosted by SUU’s Art &
___
Design Department. Admission is free, and the general public is invited to attend.
___
Holland studied art and film at Brigham Young University and animation at The Vancouver Film
___
School. He received his BFA in character animation from the California Institute of the Arts.
___
Holland currently works at Pixar Animation Studios. Holland has worked as an animator, sketch
___
artist, and art director at Pixar over the last 12 years. His latest project was as sets art director
___
on the feature film Inside Out. He has taught and lectured for the past 10 years on character
___
and animation design.
___
A love of animated films led Holland to become an artist. He describes his work as creative
___
problem solving in the most entertaining way possible. While working on a design, Holland and
___
his fellow animators at Pixar often use the phrase ‘Push it to 11’. Holland says this encourages
___
his creativity so he can push the design as far as it can go, and then some.
___
When asked where he finds his inspiration for art, Holland said, “Where DON’T I find it? The
___
most fulfilling part of my work as an artist is distilling life into something fresh. I enjoy the
___
research and the process rather than the final product.”
___
Holland’s Art Insights presentation will cover his personal inspiration, design philosophy and
___
method, as well as what it takes to collaborate with a team of artists. He will also discuss some
___
of his experiences from his work at Pixar.
___
Art Insights is hosted during the fall and spring semesters by SUU’s Art & Design faculty.
___
Students and community members meet to experience presentations and discussions by
___
visiting artists and art educators from around the nation who share their work and insights.
___
About the College of Performing and Visual Arts
___
The Southern Utah University College of Performing and Visual Arts is comprised of nationally
___
accredited departments of Art and Design, Music, and Dance. The College also offers programs
___
in Theatre Arts, graduate programs in Arts Administration and Music, as well as a Center for
___
Shakespeare Studies. The College offers 16 different degree areas, including liberal arts
___
Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Science degrees; professional Bachelor of Music and Bachelor
___
of Fine Arts in art and theatre degrees; and Master of Fine Arts in Arts Administration, Master of
___
Arts in Arts Administration, Master of Music Education and Master of Music in Music Technology
___
graduate degrees. More than 60 full- and part-time faculty and staff are engaged in teaching
___
and mentoring nearly 600 majors in the College. Over 1,100 students enroll each year in over
___
195 arts classes on the SUU campus. The College presents over 100 performances, lectures,
___
presentations, and exhibitions each year. The College’s affiliate organizations include the
___
Southern Utah Museum of Art (SUMA), Utah Shakespeare Festival and SUU’s Ballroom Dance
___
Company. For more information about the College of Performing and Visual Arts, visit
___
www.suu.edu/pva.
___
For Calendar Editors: Find Your Inspiration with Pixar’s Dan Holland
___
What: Dan Holland, an animator for Pixar Animation Studios, will be presenting an
___
artist talk at the Southern Utah Museum of Art on December 1, 2016, at 7:00 pm.
___
Holland’s presentation is part of the Art Insights series hosted by SUU’s Art &
___
Design Department. Admission is free, and the general public is invited to attend.
___
Who: Art Insights, Southern Utah University, Department of Art & Design
___
When: Thursday, December 1, 2016
___
Time: 7:00 p.m.
___
Where: Southern Utah Museum of Art, 13 S 300 W, Cedar City, Utah
___
Tickets: Free admission, General Public invited to attend
___
Info: Visit www.suu.edu/pva for more information
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Dan Holland

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Whether you’re a complete beginner taking your first country class OR a more experienced dancer with some country dancing knowledge, this Country Western Crash Course will shape you into the person on the dance floor that everyone wants to be\! After just 12 wks, you’ll know how to Country Swing, Two Step, & Line Dance so you can have a blast on those evenings at country bars and clubs\. Why: Country is a relaxed, fun style of dance that you can do to most any music\! Be confident when the music comes on at parties, weddings, & bars by learning country moves\. When: This is a 12 wk course held on Thursdays at 7pm – class is 50 minutes\. Start Dec 1, join by Dec 8 at the latest, no classes Dec 22 & 29 for the holidays Cost: During the first 2 wks, you can drop in for $15 a class to try it out; When you buy the whole course, you get a discounted rate of $10 per class \- $120 total for 12 wks\. Bonus: FREE practice sessions on Thursdays at 6pm when you buy the whole course\. http://www\.dfdancestudio\.com/country\-dancing\.html 801\.466\.0490 DF Dance Studio 2978 S State St SLC
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Country Western Dancing - Look Smooth on the Dance Floor

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
If you love 60’s girl group pop music and you also love Christmas, then you are in for a real treat\. “The Winter Wonderettes” follows Missy, Suzy, Betty Jean, and Cindy Lou as they sing favorite holiday classics with a new spin, like Santa Clause is Coming to Town, Jingle Bell Rock, and Santa baby\. Audiences will feel like singing along and dancing in the aisle as the Wonderettes take us back to a more innocent time\.
It’s 1968 and the Wonderettes are the entertainment for Harpers Hardware Holiday party\. When Santa \(aka the boss, Mr\. Harper\) is a no\-show, the ladies find that it’s up to them to make sure the evening is filled with Christmas cheer and everyone has a Merry Christmas\.
Directed by Addison Welch and lead by the loveable cast of Wonderette Women: Mollee Steel \(Missy\), Kirsten Jacobsen \(Cindy Lou\), Kenzie Stinger \(Suzy\) and Tatiana Quinn \(Betty Jean\) this production of “The Winter Wonderettes” is sure to be your new holiday favorite\.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Winter Wonderettes

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: The musical production Savior of the World, based on scriptural accounts of the birth and Resurrection of Jesus Christ, will return to the Conference Center Theater for the Christmas season\. The show features a cast of talented actors, singers, and musicians sharing testimony through drama and song of the divine mission of Jesus Christ, the Son of God and Savior of the world\. According to the director, "the purpose of this production is to testify of Jesus Christ\. During the Christmas season, Savior of the World provides a meaningful opportunity for all to remember His birth and Resurrection and renew their devotion to Him\." The production, presented in the state\-of\-the\-art Conference Center Theater, features a beautiful soundtrack\. Friday, November 18, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Saturday, November 19, 2016, 2:00 p\.m\. \(matinee\) Saturday, November 19, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Tuesday, November 22, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Wednesday, November 23, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Friday, November 25, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Saturday, November 26, 2016, 2:00 p\.m\. \(matinee\) Saturday, November 26, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Tuesday, November 29, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Wednesday, November 30, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Thursday, December 1, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Friday, December 2, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Saturday, December 3, 2016, 2:00 p\.m\. \(matinee\) Saturday, December 3, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Tuesday, December 13, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Wednesday, December 14, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Thursday, December 15, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Friday, December 16, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Saturday, December 17, 2016, 2:00 p\.m\. \(special needs matinee\-closed captioning available\) Saturday, December 17, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Tuesday, December 20, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Wednesday, December 21, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Thursday, December 22, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Friday, December 23, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Saturday, December 24, 2016, 12:30 p\.m\. \(Christmas Eve matinee\) Tuesday, December 27, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Wednesday, December 28, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Thursday, December 29, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Friday, December 30, 2016, 7:30 p\.m\. Saturday, December 31, 2016, 12:30 p\.m\. \(matinee\) Tickets Savior of the World is an assigned seating event\. Please refer to the section, row, and seat number on your ticket\. On Tuesday, October 4, 2016, tickets can be obtained online at lds\.org/events or by calling 801\-570\-0080 \(locally\) or toll\-free 1\-866\-537\-8457 \(1\-866\-LDS\-TIKS\) beginning at 10:00 a\.m\. Based on availability, tickets can be obtained in person at the ticket office located at door 4 of the Conference Center\. The ticket office is open from 10:00 a\.m\. to 5:00 p\.m\. Monday through Friday\. Evening and matinee performance tickets are $10\.00 each\. A $2\.00 convenience fee will be added to the cost of each ticket purchased online\. A $1\.00 delivery fee will be applied to your order if you choose to have them delivered via USPS\. Will\-call service will only be available seven days before each performance when ordering tickets online or over the phone\. All will\-call orders will be charged a $5\.00 will\-call fee\. No refunds or exchanges on the night of the performance\. Special Considerations Those attending the production should consider traffic congestion, plan to arrive early, and park in designated parking areas only\. On the day of each performance, parking is available under the Conference Center by showing your event ticket to the parking attendant\. The Conference Center Theater exterior doors 1\-3 will open 60 minutes before each performance start time\. Interior house doors will open approximately 30 minutes before start time\. Ticket holders are requested to be in their seats no later than 15 minutes before the performance begins\. Children ages eight and older are welcome at all performances\. No babies, please\. Ambulatory impairment seating is available\. Patrons who require such seating should inform the ticket office when they obtain tickets or inform Guest Services when they arrive at the event\. Patrons should not bring cameras or audio or video recording devices into the performance halls\. Photographs are not permitted during the performance\. Sunday dress is encouraged\. Patrons should turn off pagers, cellular phones, and similar electronic devices during the performance\. Food and beverages are not permitted in performance halls\. Weapons are not permitted in performance halls\. Patrons may not bring packages or backpacks into performance halls\. The length of the performance is approximately two hours with an intermission\. Print E\-mail Twitter Facebook " " Obtain Tickets Online Do you have feedback?
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Savior of the World

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Music and original English Liberetto by Gian Carlo Menotti
___
Dec. 1-3, 7:30 p.m.; Dec. 3 matinee, 2 p.m.
*Main Stage, Opera, Limited Engagement in partnership with the University of Utah School of Music & the Salt Lake Symphony*
___
___
An opera in one act, the show was commissioned by NBC and first performed by the NBC Opera Theatre on December 24, 1951, in New York City at Rockefeller Center, where it was broadcast live on television from that venue as the debut production of the Hallmark Hall of Fame. The story centers around Amahl, a disabled boy who can only walk with a crutch and has a problem with telling tall tales. One night he is amazed when he sees three splendidly dressed kings, the Magi on their way to witness the birth of the Christ child, standing outside his door. This charming and heartwarming story, told through the eyes of a child, is a delight for audiences of all ages.
___
___
**No refunds. Limited Exchanges. No Children Under 5. Doors open 30 minutes prior to start time.**
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: Amahl and the Night Visitors

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description: Dan Waldis “A Little Jazz With Your Mistletoe” Night One is a great way to start the Christmas season! Special guest singer, the lovely Allison Ottley joins the group to bring her silvery voice to the group of some of the best jazz musicians around. Dan Waldis on piano, Dave Halliday on sax, Steve Brown on bass, and Dave Murphy on percussion with Allison Ottley on vocals. The unique jazz arrangements of familiar traditional Christmas favorites are Dan’s specialty. “A Little Jazz With Your Mistletoe” has become a family a favorite for many years. Jazz fans and music lovers alike join with us in the celebration! We hope you’ll start your tradition with us this year and enjoy two great evening performances – come for one night or two!! See you there!
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: A Little Jazz with Your Mistletoe

d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Description:
Fresh off his debut television appearance on Live at Gotham and the release of his debut comedy special I Got Questions, award-winning stand-up comedian John Crist continues to gain momentum as one of America’s young rising stars of comedy. Crist’s style of edgy but clean comedy keeps him on the road for a whirlwind schedule of over 250 live shows per year. A regional finalist in Comedy Central’s Up Next Competition and over 10 million Buzzfeed views, Crist just returned from a USO Comedy Tour for the Troops in Kuwait…all while headlining top comedy clubs across the country and sharing the stage with the likes of Dave Chappelle, Seth Meyers, Tim Hawkins,Chris D’Elia, and Anjelah Johnson.
From joking about texting and driving and the ills of social media, telling people their children aren’t winners, or breaking out into choreographed dances in Hobby Lobby, Crist performs from a point of view that’s distinctly his own.
d2p1:jsEvent.d2p1:Name: John Crist
